snippet: A voluntary deal with federal regulators will put the feature in most cars and light trucks within six years, and in heavier vehicles two years later.
abstract: Voluntary pact between 20 automakers and transportation officials will make automatic braking system a standard safety feature for most vehicles within eight years.
lead_paragraph: A voluntary deal with federal regulators will put the feature in most cars and light trucks within six years, and in heavier vehicles two years later.

headline.main: Carmakers Agree to Make Automatic Braking Standard Without a Rule
headline.print_headline: Automakers in Agreement on Standard for Brakes
